author: j.lw
content: This isn't exactly what you are looking for, but you may find these helpful: https://github.com/J-Lw/cohort-four/blob/master/program-guide/program-details.md#phase-one https://github.com/J-Lw/cohort-four/blob/master/program-guide/repo-guide.md

author: eniko1555
content:
I'm glad to be here. I discovered the fellowship program a few days ago, and I'm still working on my application. 
As I'm late, I am still determining what project I want to work on. Does that have any implications for the application?

author: j.lw
content: As far as I'm aware, phase one and two of the program are focused on learning and defining a deliverable project. In other words, you're on track, so not knowing what exactly you want to do for a project is shouldn't carry significant weight on your application. That said, it is probably smart to do a bit of reading so that you can answer the question "what area of the protocol would you like to work on" in an educated way.

author: eniko1555
content: Oh, good to hear. Yes, I will do the required research soon, just two days it's too short for that ðŸ˜¢

author: joshd4078
content: Much of the conversation happens in this channel or in private discussions between fellows. We will go over this in the first stand-up meeting of the cohort. You are not required to have a project decided in order to submit an application.
